commit_message:
Fix the bug that the size of volume isn't consistent with flavor

When we launch a instance using "boot from image" option
and the image is the snapshot of a volume-backed instance,
we do not have the interface in dashboard or command-line to
input the size of the volume. Finally, we will get a
volume-backed instance and the size of its volume equals
the size of snapshot.

In this patch, we make the size of the volume equals the size
defined in flavor instead of the size of snapshot in such
situation.

Closes-Bug: #1380493
Change-Id: I78a3dca77937a54a2227db65ea0d0982152e1bf9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/97/128497/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Note(luogangyi): In the condition that user doesn't give the # size of volume, using the size defined in flavor instead. # This happens when we launch a instance using "boot from image" # and the image is the snapshot of a volume-backed instance. self._adjust_bdm_according_to_flavor(instance, bdms) def _adjust_bdm_according_to_flavor(self, instance, bdms): for bdm in bdms: # Note(luogangyi): Only change the root device's block-device-mapping # if the destination_type is volume and the volume_size was not given. if (bdm.get('boot_index', -1) == 0 and bdm.get('destination_type', 'local') == 'volume' and bdm.get('volume_size', None) is None): bdm['volume_size'] = instance['root_gb'] bdm.update(dict(volume_size=instance['root_gb']))

 NovaServers.boot_and_delete_server

 Quotas.nova_update_and_delete
 Quotas.nova_update

Change-Id: I370b2ef5412d59972da926b43543812050b969e7

commit_message:
No need to backup instance when 'rotation' == 0

Nova will delete all backup images according the 'backup_type' parameter
when 'rotation' equals to 0.

But according the logic now, Nova will generate one new backup, and then
delete it. So It's weird to snapshot a useless backup firstly.

We need to add one new branch here:
if 'rotation' is equal to 0, no need to backup, just rotate it.

Change-Id: I10d8adde79cdcd5cf66411dac955745d06d5ceb5
Closes-Bug: #1334923

commit_message:
Disallow hard reboot for suspended instances

Suspend is exposed in the admin_actions API extension and it is likely
that a deployer will have their policy configured so that suspend/resume
are admin only.  So we should disallow switching from SUSPEND to ACTIVE
via reboot and have a user resume before rebooting.

Change-Id: I92b30aa97df6ac1b72ad668a262a5d5f26b5fc15

commit_message:
Libvirt: Add support for storage XML to config

This commit adds support to the libvirt driver's config
file for parsing and serializing libvirt storage pool
and storage volume information.

Implements bp: use-libvirt-storage-pools

Change-Id: Ief680c22ff10b6c25930d6cba118146114ab7d0f

commit_message:
VFS: Fix test patching oslo.utils.import_module

`oslo.utils.import_module` is called
`oslo.utils.importutils.importmodule`.  This was causing the affect
test in 'nova/tests/unit/virt/disk/test_api.py' not not function
correctly.  This is now fixed.

Change-Id: Ie68bec10fcdfbd67ab53959a8b8d157e802c7a53

commit_message:
HyperV - Fix attach volume with CHAP.

Currently the HyperV Driver ignores the CHAP credentials
while adding the Target Portal to the host.
For this reason, attach volume fails if CHAP is enforced
on HP LeftHand and HP 3Par backends.
This patch allows for attaching volumes which are created
with CHAP enabled on on HP LeftHand and HP 3Par backends.
The changes are done for both V1 and V2 storage API for Windows.

Change-Id: I0b3aa603502b76a262666039e7b347e2f38241b1
Closes-Bug: #1403836

commit_message:
EC2: Reorganize code for EC2 tags

This change makes the EC2 tags' code more generic, so that
tags for new resources can be added easily.

DocImpact: When an invalid EC2 instance ID was supplied, e.g. 'abcd',
    instead of a valid one like 'i-12345678', the DescribeTags API
    used to throw InstanceNotFound (HTTP 404). This has been changed
    to InvalidEc2Id (HTTP 400) after this change. This is a valid
    change as it is EC2 API (doesn't have different HTTP status
    codes), and we are correcting our previous EC2 API behavior to
    match with the upstream Amazon EC2 API behavior.

Progress on:
Blueprint: ec2-volume-and-snapshot-tags
Change-Id: Iba774d55c84dbbef57c56cd331b3ffcd7e41f3ec
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/63/111563/16 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def uuid_from_only_resource_id(res_id): ctxt = context.get_admin_context() res_type = resource_type_from_id(ctxt, res_id) if res_type == 'volume': return ec2_vol_id_to_uuid(res_id) elif res_type == 'instance': return ec2_inst_id_to_uuid(ctxt, res_id) elif res_type == 'snapshot': return ec2_snap_id_to_uuid(res_id) else: raise exception.InvalidEc2Id(ec2_id=res_id) if resource_type_from_id(context, ec2_id) != 'instance': raise exception.InvalidEc2Id(ec2_id) if resource_type_from_id(context, ec2_id) != 'volume': raise exception.InvalidEc2Id(ec2_id) if resource_type_from_id(context, ec2_id) != 'snapshot': raise exception.InvalidEc2Id(ec2_id)

commit_message:
[WIP] bgp_speaker and bgp_dr_agent RPC interface

This is a work-in-progress with the goal of laying out the RPC interface
between bgp_speaker service plugin and the bgp_dr_agent. Please review
if interested in helping design the RPC interface.

Change-Id: I4c69c0d5627eecbf5c700e95a313043c2c4e217e
Partially-Implements: blueprint bgp-dynamic-routing

This bug fix will not work if the availability zone is not

commit_message:
Fix the inconsistent info of availability zone

If the default availability zone is replaced with the
newly-created one, then it causes the info of availability
zone to be inconsistent for every retrieval in the process
of launching new VM instance.

This bug fix will not work if the availability zone is not
specified (e.g. via CLI of nova boot).

Change-Id: I50d3515f94a37cb564ca26b9ef667e3a3cfd2b62
Closes-Bug: #1390033
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/15/159015/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Add previous page links for Nova GET servers API
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-13 13:06:13.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/3ba6f75184468da30277ee335eb3d4b7e0a7db45', 'message': "Add previous page links for Nova GET servers API

This change is to support the v2 and v3 /servers and /servers/detail
APIs to support providing previous page links in server_links.

This patch set contains utility functions to:
* Reverse the sort directions when is_reverse is True
* Reverse the instance list when is_reverse is True
* Add previous page links using marker of the first item and is_reverse

The idea of this change is to get the previous page of servers by searching
from the first item in the reverse direction. And the final result should
also be reversed to keep up the actual direction. A new 'is_reverse' param
is added to determine whether to reverse the sort directions or not.

Change-Id: I9dbcf9f969cc0e3329c218179b1643dcc5d22783
Implements: blueprint nova-pagination-prevpage
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-03-15 14:04:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/56d365ade51f4af7227a3dcece729d34cadf6aef', 'message': "Add previous page links for Nova GET servers API

This change is to support the v2 and v3 /servers and /servers/detail
APIs to support providing previous page links in server_links.

This patch set contains utility functions to:
* Reverse the sort directions when is_reverse is True
* Reverse the instance list when is_reverse is True
* Add previous page links using marker of the first item and is_reverse

commit_message:
Add previous page links for Nova GET servers API

This change is to support the v2 and v3 /servers and /servers/detail
APIs to support providing previous page links in server_links.

This patch set contains utility functions to:
* Reverse the sort directions when is_reverse is True
* Reverse the instance list when is_reverse is True
* Add previous page links using marker of the first item and is_reverse

The idea of this change is to get the previous page of servers by searching
from the first item in the reverse direction. And the final result should
also be reversed to keep up the actual direction. A new 'is_reverse' param
is added to determine whether to reverse the sort directions or not.

Change-Id: I9dbcf9f969cc0e3329c218179b1643dcc5d22783
Implements: blueprint nova-pagination-prevpage

commit_message:
VMware: Attach iSCSI volume support CHAP authentication

Currently, VMware driver use the "Dynamic Discovery" to discover the
targets, and can't support to add the CHAP authentication info to a
target. But by default, the 'lioadm' iscsi helper will enable the
authentication attribute to each volume.

This patch create a static target with auth info for host to make sure
the host has authority to connect to the target.

Change-Id: I2403993e8365ee58d588fb64484bb94b1cb609ea
Closes-bug: #1437993
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/95/168795/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _wrap_auth_connection_data(self): data = {'volume': 'vm-10', 'volume_id': 'volume-fake-id', 'target_portal': 'fake-host:fake-port', 'target_iqn': 'fake-target-iqn', 'auth_method': 'CHAP', 'auth_username': 'fake-username', 'auth_password': 'fake-password'} return data def test_iscsi_build_static_target(self): data = self._wrap_auth_connection_data() static_target = self._volumeops._iscsi_build_static_target(data) self.assertEqual('fake-host', static_target.address) self.assertEqual('fake-port', static_target.port) self.assertEqual('fake-host:fake-port', static_target.parent) self.assertEqual('fake-target-iqn', static_target.iScsiName) self.assertEqual('fake-username', static_target.authenticationProperties.chapName) self.assertEqual('fake-password', static_target.authenticationProperties.chapSecret) def test_iscsi_add_static_target(self): self.called = False def fake_call_method(vim, method, *args, **kwargs): if method == 'AddInternetScsiStaticTargets': self.called = True return fake_call_method data = self._wrap_auth_connection_data() with(mock.patch.object(self._session, '_call_method', fake_call_method)): self._volumeops._iscsi_add_static_target(data, self._instance) self.assertEqual(3, fake_call_method.call_count) self.assertTrue(self.called) def test_iscsi_remove_static_target(self): self.called = False def fake_call_method(vim, method, *args, **kwargs): if method == 'RemoveInternetScsiStaticTargets': self.called = True return fake_call_method data = self._wrap_auth_connection_data() with(mock.patch.object(self._session, '_call_method', fake_call_method)): self._volumeops._iscsi_remove_static_target(data, self._instance) self.assertEqual(3, fake_call_method.call_count) self.assertTrue(self.called)

in order to attach iscis disk to a VM, firstly need to get iscsi information such as hba and iscsi topology from that host where the VM resides. get_host_ref_for_vm should be used instead of get_host_ref which simply returns the first host in the managed cluster.

'}, {'number': 19, 'created': '2015-03-16 09:22:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/298934935b7060739d3de3b9f410352fc4799207', 'message': "Vmware:Fix how VolumeOps is getting host information

In order to attach iscsi disk to a VM, firstly need to
get iscsi information such as hba and iscsi topology from
that host where the VM resides. So when an instance is
specified, use get_host_ref_for_vm instead of
get_host_ref which simply returns the first host in
the managed cluster. get_host_ref is still used to get the
first host in the cluster if no instance is specified.

DocImpact

Limitations:
1. you wouldn't be able to vMotion it.
2. you wouldn't be able to take the corresponding host down for
maintenance without shutting down all instances running on it.
3. you wouldn't be able to migrate the instance util you detached
all iscsi devices.

Change-Id: I8e2b9725b9e99931731a9b1e52d799dca43bae74
Closes-Bug: #1386975

the managed cluster. get_host_ref is still used to get the

1. you wouldn't be able to vMotion it.
2. you wouldn't be able to take the corresponding host down for
maintenance without shutting down all instances running on it.
3. you wouldn't be able to migrate the instance until you detached
all iscsi devices.

commit_message:
Vmware:Fix how VolumeOps is getting host information

In order to attach iscsi disk to a VM, first, it need to
get iscsi information such as hba and iscsi topology from
that host where the VM resides. So when an instance is
specified, use get_host_ref_for_vm instead of
get_host_ref which simply returns the first host in
the managed cluster. get_host_ref is still used to get the
first host in the cluster if no instance is specified.

DocImpact

Limitations:
1. you wouldn't be able to vMotion it.
2. you wouldn't be able to take the corresponding host down for
maintenance without shutting down all instances running on it.
3. you wouldn't be able to migrate the instance until you detached
all iscsi devices.

Change-Id: I8e2b9725b9e99931731a9b1e52d799dca43bae74
Closes-Bug: #1386975

commit_message:
libvirt: Decomposition plug methods in vif

It'll be better if do not use nearly duplicated code
in different locations.

Separated duplicated code into new method.

Change-Id: I9d46e1f5bee8ed5ab1f9f07f7391536b44ff6969
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/19/148719/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _check_firewall_required_or_is_hybrid_plug_enabled(self, vif): return self.get_firewall_required(vif) or vif.is_hybrid_plug_enabled() def _plug_port(self, instance, vif, port=None): if port == 'ovs': if self._check_firewall_required_or_is_hybrid_plug_enabled(vif): self.plug_ovs_hybrid(instance, vif) else: self.plug_ovs_bridge(instance, vif) elif port == 'ivs': if self._check_firewall_required_or_is_hybrid_plug_enabled(vif): self.plug_ivs_hybrid(instance, vif) else: self.plug_ivs_ethernet(instance, vif) def plug_ovs(self, instance, vif): self._plug_port(instance, vif, port='ovs') self._plug_port(instance, vif, port='ivs')
deleted_lines: def plug_ovs(self, instance, vif): if self.get_firewall_required(vif) or vif.is_hybrid_plug_enabled(): self.plug_ovs_hybrid(instance, vif) else: self.plug_ovs_bridge(instance, vif) if self.get_firewall_required(vif) or vif.is_hybrid_plug_enabled(): self.plug_ivs_hybrid(instance, vif) else: self.plug_ivs_ethernet(instance, vif)

commit_message:
Recover instance state after nova-compute failure during spawn

If nova-compute stopped while an instance was spawning, check if it's running
during startup. In case it was fully spawned, set the proper states.

Change-Id: Ie0d4dd3293e54fdd91210c53d08f90e1bc045553
Closes-Bug: 1072734
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/81/167281/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # If Nova compute stopped while the instance was spawning, # check if the instance was fully spawned. current_power_state = self._get_power_state(context, instance) if (current_power_state == power_state.RUNNING and instance.task_state == task_states.SPAWNING): # Instance was fully spawned - set the states. instance.power_state = current_power_state instance.vm_state = vm_states.ACTIVE instance.task_state = None instance.launched_at = timeutils.utcnow() instance.save() return

commit_message:
Fix the inconsistent info of availability zone

If the default availability zone is replaced with the
newly-created one, then it causes the info of availability
zone to be inconsistent for every retrieval in the process
of launching new VM instance.

This bug fix will not work if the availability zone is not
specified (e.g. via CLI of nova boot).

Change-Id: I025c5f9db7963c91803ba9417133b99f9b3d81ca
Closes-Bug: #1390033

commit_message:
Append openstacklib/lib to load path for type

As we discovered before[1] with puppet-keystone, rspec-puppet has
trouble loading paths in some circumstances. This patch updates the
$LOAD_PATH in the newly rewritten glance_image type so that unit tests
in other modules can properly load the openstacklib backend.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/puppet-keystone/+bug/1408531

Change-Id: Ifa3cbd46b8b32695848d4c2e8f837881c46a7d98
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-glance refs/changes/94/211794/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: File.expand_path('../../../../openstacklib/lib', File.dirname(__FILE__)).tap { |dir| $LOAD_PATH.unshift(dir) unless $LOAD_PATH.include?(dir) }

commit_message:
Remove service_type requirement from catalog searching

The standard reason to search the catalog is that you want to know how
to find a particular service type. However with service_id and
endpoint_id you may not want to specify a service_type.

Allow searching for a url without specifying a service_type.

Change-Id: I038fe5b0e04b689f1072db659219639d5193f558

commit_message:
Move common request processing to base class

Move the standard parts of token validation onto the base class. To make
this work in a way that is useful for both keystone and auth_token we
need to fetch and validate the tokens and then enforce what to do with
the request at a higher level.

Change-Id: I01ec6798b6c029c0013f4bcf73697c92a3063f4b

added_lines: def process_request(self, request): request.remove_auth_headers() user_auth_ref = None serv_auth_ref = None user_token = request.headers.get('X-Auth-Token', request.headers.get('X-Storage-Token') ) if user_token: try: self._LOG.debug('Authenticating user token') user_auth_ref = self._validate_token(user_token, request) request.set_user_headers(user_auth_ref, self._include_service_catalog) except exc.InvalidToken: self._LOG.info(_LI('Invalid user token')) request.user_token_valid = False else: # if no user token is present then that's an invalid request request.user_token_valid = False serv_token = request.headers.get('X-Service-Token') if serv_token: try: self._LOG.debug('Authenticating service token') serv_auth_ref = self._validate_token(serv_token, request) request.set_service_headers(serv_auth_ref) except exc.InvalidToken: self._LOG.info(_LI('Invalid service token')) request.service_token_valid = False p = _user_plugin.UserAuthPlugin(user_auth_ref, serv_auth_ref) request.environ['keystone.token_auth'] = p resp = super(AuthProtocol, self).process_request(request) if resp: return resp if not request.valid: if self._delay_auth_decision: self._LOG.info(_LI("Deferring reject downstream")) else: self._LOG.info(_LI("Rejecting Request")) self._reject_request() self._LOG.debug('Received request from %s' % request.environ['keystone.token_auth']._log_format) return auth_ref except exc.ServiceError as e: self._LOG.critical(_LC('Unable to obtain admin token: %s'), e) raise webob.exc.HTTPServiceUnavailable()
deleted_lines: def process_request(self, req): request.remove_auth_headers() try: user_auth_ref = None serv_auth_ref = None try: self._LOG.debug('Authenticating user token') user_token_info = self._get_user_token_from_request(request) user_auth_ref, user_token_info = self._validate_token( user_token_info, request) request.environ['keystone.token_info'] = user_token_info request.set_user_headers(user_auth_ref, self._include_service_catalog) except exc.InvalidToken: if self._delay_auth_decision: self._LOG.info( _LI('Invalid user token - deferring reject ' 'downstream')) request.headers['X-Identity-Status'] = 'Invalid' else: self._LOG.info( _LI('Invalid user token - rejecting request')) self._reject_request() try: self._LOG.debug('Authenticating service token') serv_token = request.headers.get('X-Service-Token') if serv_token is not None: serv_auth_ref, serv_token_info = self._validate_token( serv_token, request) request.set_service_headers(serv_auth_ref) except exc.InvalidToken: if self._delay_auth_decision: self._LOG.info( _LI('Invalid service token - deferring reject ' 'downstream')) request.headers['X-Service-Identity-Status'] = 'Invalid' else: self._LOG.info( _LI('Invalid service token - rejecting request')) self._reject_request() p = _user_plugin.UserAuthPlugin(user_auth_ref, serv_auth_ref) request.environ['keystone.token_auth'] = p except exc.ServiceError as e: self._LOG.critical(_LC('Unable to obtain admin token: %s'), e) raise webob.exc.HTTPServiceUnavailable() self._LOG.debug('Received request from %s' % p._log_format) def _get_user_token_from_request(self, request): """Get token id from request. :param env: wsgi request environment :returns: token id :raises exc.InvalidToken: if no token is provided in request """ token = request.headers.get('X-Auth-Token', request.headers.get('X-Storage-Token')) if token: return token else: if not self._delay_auth_decision: self._LOG.debug('Headers: %s', dict(request.headers)) raise exc.InvalidToken(_('Unable to find token in headers')) return auth_ref, data except exc.ServiceError: raise

commit_message:
Policy support

Zaqar needs to support policy. This proposal is for adding
policy.json and leveraging olso.policy to implement fine-grained
permissions for Zaqar's Rest API endpoints.

blueprint: fine-grained-permissions

Co-Authored-By: Louis Taylor <louis@kragniz.eu>

Change-Id: I61ff36b12d7128aae88a8b4da19be90c9faa0a02
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/zaqar-specs refs/changes/73/179673/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This template should be in ReSTructured text. The filename in the git repository should match the launchpad URL, for example a URL of https://blueprints.launchpad.net/zaqar/+spec/awesome-thing should be named awesome-thing.rst. Please do not delete any of the sections in this template. If you have nothing to say for a whole section, just write: None For help with syntax, see http://sphinx-doc.org/rest.html To test out your formatting, see http://www.tele3.cz/jbar/rest/rest.html ============================ Authorization Policy Support ============================ OpenStack components are supposed to check user privileges to perform any action. Generally these checks are role-based. See http://docs.openstack.org/developer/keystone/architecture.html#approach-to-authorization-policy. Zaqar needs to support policies as well. Problem description =================== Now Zaqar is missing fine-grained permissions for actions. For example, it's hard to allow one user only can get message from a queue but not be able to post message to the queue, or something like that. Proposed change =============== Add policy check for all Zaqar API endpoints. This could be done by following the same way as in other OpenStack components, by leveraging the olso.policy module which will do all the underlying work. Proposed content of the policy file: .. sourcecode:: json { "context_is_admin": "role:admin", "admin_or_owner": "is_admin:True or project_id:%(project_id)s", "default": "rule:admin_or_owner", "queues:get_all": "", "queues:put": "", "queues:get": "", "queues:delete": "", "messages:post": "", "messages:get": "", "messages:bulk_get": "", "messages:bulk_delete": "", "messages:claim": "", "subscriptions:get_all": "", "subscriptions:create": "", "subscriptions:get": "", "subscriptions:delete": "", "subscriptions:update": "", } Alternatives ------------ None. Data model impact ----------------- None. REST API impact --------------- None. Other end user impact --------------------- None. Deployer impact --------------- None. Developer impact ---------------- New API endpoint will be required to change policy rules. None. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: flwang (Feilong Wang) Work Items ---------- * Add config options to point to control policy file and settings * Add policy check to all API calls * Add unit tests * Add documentation Dependencies ============ * oslo.policy Testing ======= * Unit tests * Manual testing Documentation Impact ==================== * Feature need to be documented References ========== * http://docs.openstack.org/developer/keystone/architecture.html#approach-to-authorization-policy * http://docs.openstack.org/developer/keystone/api/keystone.openstack.common.policy.html * http://docs.openstack.org/developer/keystone/configuration.html#keystone-api-protection-with-role-based-access-control-rbac

added_lines: "POT-Creation-Date: 2015-08-11 06:23+0000\n" "PO-Revision-Date: 2015-08-12 03:48+0000\n""アーキテクチャー例では、 OpenStack Havana の現在のデフォルト機能セットをベー" "スとし、高可用性に重点を置いて記載しました。/var/lib/nova/instances が共" "有 NFS マウントであることに注意したい。これは、全てのコンピュートノードがその""ドライバ・アーキテクチャーを使う他のプロジェクトで、類似のパターンに従うこと" "ができます。単純に、そのドライバーインタフェースに従うモジュールとクラスを作" "成し、環境定義によって組み込んでください。あなたのコードはその機能が使われた" "時に実行され、必要に応じて他のサービスを呼び出します。プロジェクトのコアコー" "ドは一切修正しません。ドライバーアーキテクチャーを使っているプロジェクトを確" "認するには、/etc/<project> に格納されている、プロジェクト" "の .conf 設定ファイルの中で driver 変数を探してくださ" "い。""アスタリスク (*) は、アーキテクチャーの例がデフォルトインストールの設定から逸" "脱している箇所を示しています。この逸脱については、次のセクションで説明しま" "す。オブジェクト を参照してください。""\"openstack-diagram\"/> には、OpenStack の最も一般的な論理アーキテクチャーを" "示しています。ただし、これは唯一のアーキテクチャーではありません。""多くのアーキテクチャーの選択肢と同様に、環境により適切なソリューションは変" "わって来ます。既存のハードウェアを使用する場合、サーバーのディスク密度を把握" "し、上記のオプションをもとに意思決定していきます。調達プロセスを行っている場" "合、ユーザー要件などもハードウェア購入決定の一助となります。ここでは AT&" "T の Web 開発者にカスタムの環境を提供するプライベートクラウドの例をあげていま" "す。この例は、特定のデプロイメントであるため、既存のハードウェアや調達機会は" "これと異なる可能性があります。AT&T は、デプロイメントに 3 種類のハード" "ウェアを使用しています。""するドキュメントを執筆するのは難しいため、本ガイドではアーキテクチャーの例を" "定義することによって文書化の作業を簡素化すると共に、本書のスコープを規定しま" "す。以下に紹介するアーキテクチャーの例はいずれも本番環境で現在実行中であり、""テクチャー例では、コンピュートノードで、ハイパーバイザー (KVM)、libvirt (ノー" "ド間でのライブマイグレーションを可能にするハイパーバイザー用ドライバー)、""Depending on your specific configuration, performing a dist-upgrade might restart services supplemental to your OpenStack environment. For " "example, if you use Open-iSCSI for Block Storage volumes and the upgrade " "includes a new open-scsi package, the package manager restarts " "Open-iSCSI services, which might cause the volumes for your users to be " "disconnected." msgstr "" "お使いの設定によっては、dist-upgrade を実行することにより、" "OpenStack 環境の補助サービスが再起動するかもしれません。例えば、Block " "Storage ボリューム向けに Open-iSCSI フレームワークを使用していて、その新しい " "open-scsi パッケージがアップグレードに含まれる場合、パッケージマ" "ネージャーが Open-iSCSI サービスを再起動します。これにより、ユーザーのボ" "リュームが切断される可能性があります。" msgid """初めての本格的な OpenStack クラウドのアーキテクチャーの設計と構築。この本を読" "み終えると、コンピュート、ネットワーク、ストレージのリソースを選ぶにはどんな" "質問を自分にすればよいのか、どのように組み上げればよいのかや、どんなソフト" "ウェアパッケージが必要かが分かることでしょう。"msgid "" "Do not edit the /etc/neutron/neutron.conf file until " "after the conversion steps." msgstr "" "変換手順が終わるまで /etc/neutron/neutron.conf ファイル" "を編集してはいけません。" msgstr "アーキテクチャー例"msgstr "アーキテクチャー例: レガシーネットワーク (nova)"msgstr "アーキテクチャー例: OpenStack Networking""For readers who need to get a specialized feature into OpenStack, this " "chapter describes how to use DevStack to write custom middleware or a custom " "scheduler to rebalance your resources." msgstr "" "OpenStack に特別な機能を追加したい読者向けに、この章は、カスタムミドルウェア" "やカスタムスケジューラーを書いて、リソースを再配置するために、DevStack を使用" "する方法について説明します。" msgid """フェイスの両方でパケットをキャプチャーするからです。""If users access your dashboard by using http://dashboard.example." "com, define , as follows:" msgstr "" "ユーザーが http://dashboard.example.com を使用してダッ" "シュボードにアクセスしている場合、以下のとおり、 を定義しま" "す。" msgid "" "If users access your dashboard by using an IP address in addition to a host " "name, define , as follows:" msgstr "" "ユーザーがホスト名以外に IP アドレスを使用してダッシュボードにアクセスしてい" "る場合、以下のとおり、 を定義します。" msgid "" "If users access your dashboard on the local system, define , " "as follows:" msgstr "" "ユーザーがローカルシステムでダッシュボードにアクセスしている場合、以下のとお" "り、 を定義します。" msgid ""msgid "" "Keep the OVS plug-in packages and configuration files until you verify the " "upgrade." msgstr "" "アップグレードの検証が終わるまで、OVS プラグインのパッケージと設定ファイルを" "残しておきます。" "多くの OpenStack のプロジェクトでは、ドライバ・アーキテクチャーを使うことに" "よって、特定の機能をカスタマイズすることができます。特定のインターフェースに" "適合するドライバを書き、環境定義によって組み込むことができます。例えば、簡単" "に Compute に新しいスケジューラーを組み込むことができます。Compute の既存のス" "ケジューラーは、完全な機能を持ち、Scheduling によくまとめられています。しかし、あなたのユーザのユー" "ス・ケースに依存して、既存のスケジューラで要件が満たせないかもしれません。こ" "の場合は、新しいスケジューラーを作成する必要があるでしょう。customizationOpenStack Compute " "(nova) Schedulertopics." msgstr "" "ほとんどの OpenStack は、ドライバーを用いて動作します。そのため、サービスの基" "本セットに別のソリューションをプラグインできます。この章は、いくつかの高度な" "設定に関する話題を取り扱います。" msgstr "アーキテクチャーについての章の結び""Read about how to track the OpenStack roadmap through the open and " "transparent development processes." msgstr "" "オープンかつ透明な OpenStack の開発プロセスからロードマップを把握する方法をま" "とめています。" msgid """So many OpenStack resources are available online because of the fast-moving " "nature of the project, but there are also resources listed here that the " "authors found helpful while learning themselves." msgstr "" "プロジェクトの急速な成熟のため、数多くの OpenStack の情報源がオンラインで利用" "可能ですが、執筆者が学習している間に有用だったリソースを一覧化しています。" msgid """高可用性の「インフラストラクチャー」サービス (全サービスの基盤となる MySQL " "や Qpid など) を提供します。 ""以下にあげる OpenStack の機能は、本ガイドに記載のアーキテクチャーではサポート" "されていますが、必須項目ではありません。""この参照アーキテクチャーは、複数のコンピュートノード、クラウドコントローラー " "1 台、インスタンスストレージ用の外部 NFS ストレージサーバー 1 台、""このアーキテクチャー例の論理図には、各ノードで実行されているサービスが示され" "ています。""Compute 用の基盤となる最もシンプルなアーキテクチャーは、単一のクラウドコント""プルなアーキテクチャーは、ユーザーを識別して API への要求をプロキシするノー" "ド 1 つと、最終的な一貫性を確保するのに十分なレプリケーションを提供する、スト""テクチャーの例では、特定のノード数は決まっていませんが、このアーキテクチャー" "を選択するにあたって考慮 および検討した点レガシーネットワーク; OpenStack Networking最もシンプルなアーキテクチャー""このアーキテクチャーコンポーネントは、以下のような理由で選択されています。""使用するアーキテクチャーの例を記載します。""このアーキテクチャー例では、OpenStack Networking は使用していません。neutron " "はマルチホストネットワークをまだサポートしておらず、また対象となる組織 (大学/" "政府機関) ではパブリックでアクセス可能な IPv4 アドレスを広範囲で利用できるの" "が理由です。レガシーネットワーク ""このアーキテクチャーの例は、OpenStack Havana の現在の" "デフォルト機能セットをベースに、安定性に重点を置いて選択しています。現在 ""に、高可用性に重点を置いて選択しています。このアーキテクチャーは、現在 Red " "Hat の 企業内 OpenStack クラウドでデプロイされており、ホステッド共有サービス" "の運用に使用されています。ホステッド共有サービスは、その性質上、高可用性が要" "求されます。OpenStack Networking ""この特定のアーキテクチャー例は、Grizzly から Havana にアップグレードされてお""(neutron) を使用する第 2 "それらがどのように相互作用するかについての構想を立てるには、図が役立ちます。"msgid "" "To restart Block Storage services:" msgstr "" "Block Storage サービスを再起動します。" "済みの基本アーキテクチャーから開始するのが最善の方法です。本ガイドでは、ベー" "スオペレーティングシステム (Ubuntu および Red Hat Enterprise Linux) 上に基本" "ピボットとネットワークアーキテクチャを備えた基本アーキテクチャーの例を 2 つ紹" "介しています。これらの 2 つの例では、他にも相違点がありますが、各例で選択にあ" "たって考慮した点と、それらのアーキテクチャーが特定の環境で適切に機能するため" "の設定指針をご理解いただけるはずです。"msgid "Upgrade packages on commit_message:
Add backups API link

  In api-ref on v2 block storage, backups API is not appeared.
To view backups API document, it needs to add link.
 
Related-Bug: #1477603
Related-Bug: #1291139

Change-Id: I6c477b1b696af971471f2932f778f018447ba41c

commit_message:
Add unit test for keypairs_client

This patch adds unit test for keypairs_client.

Change-Id: I4cb2bfe8fde9b1c745939288e0fad38c8b44f339
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/33/204433/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _test_show_keypair(self, bytes_body=False): if bytes_body: body = bytes(b'''{"keypair": { "public_key": "ssh-rsa foo Generated-by-Nova", "user_id": "525d55f98980415ba98e634972fa4a10", "name": "test", "deleted": false, "created_at": "2015-07-22T04:53:52.000000", "updated_at": null, "fingerprint": "76:24:66:49:d7:ca:6e:5c:77:ea:8e:bb:9c:15:5f:98", "deleted_at": null, "id": 1}}''') else: body = ('''{"keypair": { "public_key": "ssh-rsa foo Generated-by-Nova", "user_id": "525d55f98980415ba98e634972fa4a10", "name": "test", "deleted": false, "created_at": "2015-07-22T04:53:52.000000", "updated_at": null, "fingerprint": "76:24:66:49:d7:ca:6e:5c:77:ea:8e:bb:9c:15:5f:98", "deleted_at": null, "id": 1}}''') expected = {"public_key": "ssh-rsa foo Generated-by-Nova", "user_id": "525d55f98980415ba98e634972fa4a10", "name": "test", "deleted": False, "created_at": "2015-07-22T04:53:52.000000", "updated_at": None, "fingerprint": "76:24:66:49:d7:ca:6e:5c:77:ea:8e:bb:9c:15:5f:98", "deleted_at": None, "id": 1} response = (httplib2.Response({'status': 200}), body) self.useFixture(mockpatch.Patch( 'tempest.common.service_client.ServiceClient.get', return_value=response)) self.assertEqual(expected, self.client.show_keypair("test")) def test_show_keypair_with_str_body(self): self._test_show_keypair() def test_show_keypair_with_bytes_body(self): self._test_show_keypair(bytes_body=True)

commit_message:
Clean up test_dvr_router_rem_fips_on_restarted_agent

* self._add_fip wasn't actually doing anything useful, it just
  throws off the reader by making him/her think that line is
  important when it isn't.
* Added an assertion that checks that the FIP namespace exists
  before the reconfiguration of the router.

Change-Id: Ifd27f20d9d8d11575212b95e3bbe534bfe2d3b8f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/00/211700/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Cleanup unneeded bug workarounds

Devstack-gate was setting two different neutron config settings to work
around the related bugs below. Both bugs are marked fix released so we
no longer need these workarounds. Delete them.

Change-Id: Ib7db7a823e4baf95e523e8ba7669deaaafe25407
related-bug: #1464612
related-bug: #1432189
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack-gate refs/changes/49/210649/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Encode user-supplied metadata as json

We need to perform json encoding on these values because they may
contain characters like newlines or quotes, etc.

Change-Id: I84a17a97e7a245c92e7d91c85ce86277aef22d2e

Currently, kill a nova-api will immediacy stop WSGI service which interrupts
in-process request. This will cause problem when do upgrading.

The patch make master process stop server (close socket), then send KILL signal
to children. Because if master still open the socket, user can successfully
connected to API server. In children process, close socket first, then wait
for all greenlet to finish.

Change-Id: I2b529654f272c23e346fab13b0d7fa596c86ef13
Closes-bug: #1382390
'}, {'number': 5, 'created': '2014-10-22 06:47:39.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/c739a788b8554b9d1d28072fe24f6bfcfd581752', 'message': 'Graceful shutdown WSGI server

Currently, kill a nova-api will immediacy stop WSGI service which interrupts
in-process request. This will cause problem when do upgrading.

The patch make master process stop server (close socket), then send KILL signal
to children. Because if master still open the socket, user can successfully
connected to API server. In children process, close socket first, then wait
for all greenlet to finish.

Change-Id: I2b529654f272c23e346fab13b0d7fa596c86ef13
Closes-bug: #1382390
'}, {'number': 6, 'created': '2014-10-23 06:33:24.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/9b19b8bc927eba48e9c1db978e31820da29d4a17', 'message': 'Graceful shutdown WSGI server

Currently, killing a nova-api will immediacy stop WSGI service which
interrupts in-process request. This will cause problem when do upgrading.

The patch do two thing:

On master process side, stopping server (close socket) before sends
KILL signal to children process. Because if master still open the socket,
user can successfully connects to API server but gets no response.

On children process side, closing socket first, then waits for all greenlets
to finish, finally exits it self.

Change-Id: I2b529654f272c23e346fab13b0d7fa596c86ef13
Closes-bug: #1382390

commit_message:
WIP: Graceful shutdown WSGI server

Currently, killing a nova-api will immediately stop WSGI service which
interrupts in-process request. This will cause problem when do upgrading.
The patch do two thing:

On master process side, stopping server (close socket) before sends
KILL signal to children process. Because if master still open the socket,
user can successfully connects to API server but gets no response.

On children process side, closing socket first, then waits for all greenlets
to finish, finally exits it self.

DocImpact: graceful termination of process is not instantaneous.
To force instantaneous termination second SIGTERM signal must be sent.

Change-Id: I2b529654f272c23e346fab13b0d7fa596c86ef13
Closes-bug: #1382390

subject: Improve simple-tenant-usage API performance
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-25 10:20:28.000000000', 'files': ['nova/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/simple_tenant_usage.py', 'nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/contrib/test_simple_tenant_usage.py', 'nova/tests/unit/db/test_db_api.py', 'nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/contrib/simple_tenant_usage.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/1dca0e841f9a59e1316ecba0a118b858d933ec37', 'message': 'Improve simple-tenant-usage API performance

When simple-tenant-usage API is invoked for a particular tenant owning
large number of instances (both active & terminated), it takes long time
due to a SQL retrieving large number of records of
instance_system_metadata for instances using where in clause.

Removed system_metadata used for expected_attrs in simple-tenant-usage
API as it was only used to get flavor. Get flavor info by
instance_type_id stored in instance table instead of system_metadata.

This change improves simple-tenant-usage API performance by approx.

taking 25.778 seconds which is improved to an average of 11.496 seconds

Closes-Bug: 1421471

commit_message:
Improve simple-tenant-usage API performance

When simple-tenant-usage API is invoked for a particular tenant owning
large number of instances (both active & terminated), it takes long time
due to a SQL retrieving large number of records of
instance_system_metadata for instances using where in clause.

Removed system_metadata used for expected_attrs in simple-tenant-usage
API as it was only used to get flavor. Get flavor info by
instance_type_id stored in instance table instead of system_metadata.

This change improves simple-tenant-usage API performance by approx.
50 percentage. Earlier nova usage command for 13844 instances was
taking 25.778 seconds which is improved to an average of 11.496 seconds
with this change.

Closes-Bug: 1367944
Closes-Bug: 1421471
Change-Id: Ibed4212df0e29598d98071b8f00cb0dbcbedcabc

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-11-23 19:21:52.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/0ced17c2166735a87f3e0216b841c13e1324a66e', 'message': 'Add disable reason when enable_new_services=False

Add a new configuration option "new_services_disable_reason" that is used
as disable reason when a new service is added and "enable_new_services=False".
By default the disable message would be simply: "New service"

Services can be disabled by several reasons and the admins can use the API to
specify a reason. However, currently if new services are added and
"enable_new_services=False" there is no reason specified.

Having services disabled with no reason specified creates additional checks
on the operators side that increases with the deployment size.

DocImpact

commit_message:
No disable reason defined for new services

Services can be disabled by several reasons and admins can use the API to
specify a reason. However, currently if new services are added and
"enable_new_services=False" there is no disable reason specified.
Having services disabled with no reason specified creates additional checks on
the operators side that increases with the deployment size.

This patch specifies the disable reason "New Service" when a new service is
added and "enable_new_services=False".

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1417027

Change-Id: I3d3866e412dc1e251488b57dc0b541b34fb319f6

commit_message:
libvirt: handle numa cell distances

In order to make possible good scheduling when cells only defined
memory or cpus, we need to expose distances between cells.

Related-Bug: #1418187
Change-Id: Ib7c23e9c7b6c76f033911eadfaacc787b38b61a2

commit_message:
Skip detach when volume is no longer in-use

Detaching a volume which is not attached in cinder will return
a 500 error which prevents the nova-compute terminating the
instance.

This commit simply checks the status of the volume before
detaching it.

Change-Id: I6f529e5387f31a3cca549e6247a0195ac0e7bf6a

commit_message:
libvirt: Proxy RBD library call into a separate thread

If RBD is slow/down, calls to it can hang the thread,
resulting in problems like AMQP timeouts after a few minutes.

Proxy the calls into a separate eventlet thread so that other
operations can still be handled.  This approach was recently
used in Cinder, as well.

Related-Bug: #1401335
Closes-Bug: #1451891

Change-Id: I8674781fff958fd13e088afe2728bf22c585f9e1

commit_message:
Correct az property of instance when specifying force host/node

Currently, the server creation will succeed when specifying force_host
with an invalid availibility zone name, but which will cause failure
when subsequent action(e.g. resize) is performed.

This patch fix this problem by correcting the availability_zone property
in case of specifying invalid az when booting instance with force host. At
the same time, use CONF.default_schedule_zone if user specifies force host
or force node.

Closes-Bug: #1431194
Change-Id: I7fe25f29f6170bff2920508bbbefa208a8308495
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/42/163842/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if availability_zone not in available_zones:
deleted_lines: if forced_host is None and availability_zone not in \ available_zones:

subject: Add INFO logging to successful schedules
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-03 10:17:23.000000000', 'files': ['nova/conductor/manager.py', 'nova/conductor/tasks/live_migrate.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/54a4dbc17be52cae50cb23bd6ec021e2cb1a211e', 'message': 'Add INFO logging to successful schedules

Following the Ops midcycle, a common raised problem is
that the scheduler is not explicitely mentioning in the logs
which instance failed or successfully booted. Here, adding the
INFO logs when the instance has successfully been scheduled.
As the scheduler is not knowing the list of instance UUIDs
(only the one from the first instance given in instance_props),
we need to provide that INFO log in the conductor once
select_destinations is returning a list of hosts.

NOTE : It needs a StringFreeze exception to merge that patch
for Kilo.

Related-Bug: #1431291

Change-Id: I275e7709b5052a33305590191ac978a17010021c
'}]
commit_message:
Add INFO logging to successful schedules

Following the Ops midcycle, a common raised problem is
that the scheduler is not explicitely mentioning in the logs
which instance failed or successfully booted. Here, adding the
INFO logs when the instance has successfully been scheduled.
As the scheduler is not knowing the list of instance UUIDs
(only the one from the first instance given in instance_props),
we need to provide that INFO log in the conductor once
select_destinations is returning a list of hosts.

NOTE : It needs a StringFreeze exception to merge that patch
for Kilo.

Related-Bug: #1431291

Change-Id: I275e7709b5052a33305590191ac978a17010021c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/21/170421/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from nova.i18n import _, _LI request_spec, filter_properties) LOG.info(_LI("Instance #%(inst_uuid)s successfully " "scheduled on " "host %(host)s and node %(node)s") % {'inst_uuid': self.instance.uuid, 'host': host[0]['host'], 'node': host[0]['nodename']}) host = host[0]['host']

commit_message:
Skip unit tests for SSL + py3

When we request something from SSL wrapped app using py3 and we do not get
answer at all. In case of unit tests we face test timeout.
So, skip these tests until related b_u_g is fixed.

Change-Id: I809668e5c04b7ace45291e3d1bfd743853f55918
Related-Bug: #1482633
Partially-Implements: bp py3-compatibility
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/72/210372/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

Add a mechanism driver that implements midonet API calls
and is configurable with the ML2 plugin.

Summary of changes

local.conf.sample: add configuration samples for stacking with ML2.
midonet/functions: Move midonet specific plugin functions to this file.
ml2/functions: Add just the plugin functions that we want to override when
    stacking with midonet as the mechanism driver.
plugin.sh: Only source the functions related to the configured function.
mech_driver.py: Add all of the L2 midonet API calls.
sg_callback.py: add handlers for making midonet security group calls.
loadbalancer/driver.py: load the client because we can no longer count
    on the core plugin on having it available.
test_midonet_plugin_ml2.py: Add unit tests to test the ML2 plugin with
    midonet for an L3 service and midonet as a mechanism driver.

Partially Implements:
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/networking-midonet/+spec/midonet-ml2
Signed-off-by: Joe Mills <joe@midokura.com>

Add a mechanism and type drivers that implements midonet API calls and
is configurable with the ML2 plugin.

Summary of changes

local.conf.sample: add configuration samples for stacking with ML2.
midonet/functions: Move midonet specific plugin functions to this file.
ml2/functions: Add just the plugin functions that we want to override when
    stacking with midonet as the mechanism driver.
plugin.sh: Only source the functions related to the configured function.
mech_driver.py: Add all of the L2 midonet API calls.
constants.py: Add new constant for 'midonet' type driver name.
type_driver.py: Add midonet type driver.
sg_callback.py: add handlers for making midonet security group calls.
loadbalancer/driver.py: load the client because we can no longer count
    on the core plugin on having it available.
test_midonet_plugin_ml2.py: Add unit tests to test the ML2 plugin with
    midonet for an L3 service and midonet as a mechanism driver.
test_midonet_type_driver.py: Unit tests for midonet type driver.
setup.cfg: Entry points for mechanism and type drivers.

Partially Implements:
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/networking-midonet/+spec/midonet-ml2
Signed-off-by: Joe Mills <joe@midokura.com>
Co-Authored-By: Ryu Ishimoto <ryu@midokura.com>

commit_message:
Add Midonet ML2 Mechanism/Type Driver

Add a mechanism and type drivers that implement midonet API calls and
are configurable with the ML2 plugin.

Summary of changes:

 * New ML2 type driver for midonet
 * New ML2 mechanism driver for midonet
 * New ML2 SG callback handler for midonet
 * Devstack configurations to set up ML2 with midonet drivers
 * Entry points for the midonet ML2 drivers
 * local.conf sample files both midonet and ml2 plugins
 * README update for ML2

Partially Implements: bp/midonet-ml2
Signed-off-by: Joe Mills <joe@midokura.com>
Co-Authored-By: Ryu Ishimoto <ryu@midokura.com>

Change-Id: I0b0ce33edb108131e71f7a3307660810b55dbcf4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-midonet refs/changes/85/208785/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright (C) 2015 Midokura SARL. # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from oslo_log import helpers as log_helpers from oslo_log import log as logging from neutron.callbacks import events from neutron.callbacks import registry from neutron.callbacks import resources LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) class MidonetSecurityGroupsHandler(object): def __init__(self, client): self.client = client self.subscribe() @log_helpers.log_method_call def create_security_group(self, resource, event, trigger, **kwargs): security_group = kwargs.get('security_group') self.client.create_security_group_precommit(security_group) self.client.create_security_group_postcommit(security_group) @log_helpers.log_method_call def update_security_group(self, resource, event, trigger, **kwargs): pass @log_helpers.log_method_call def delete_security_group(self, resource, event, trigger, **kwargs): security_group_id = kwargs.get('security_group_id') self.client.delete_security_group_rule_precommit(security_group_id) self.client.delete_security_group_rule_postcommit(security_group_id) @log_helpers.log_method_call def create_security_group_rule(self, resource, event, trigger, **kwargs): security_group_rule = kwargs.get('security_group_rule') self.client.create_security_group_rule_precommit(security_group_rule) self.client.create_security_group_rule_postcommit(security_group_rule) @log_helpers.log_method_call def delete_security_group_rule(self, resource, event, trigger, **kwargs): security_group_rule_id = kwargs.get('security_group_rule_id') self.client.delete_security_group_rule(security_group_rule_id) def subscribe(self): registry.subscribe( self.create_security_group, resources.SECURITY_GROUP, events.AFTER_CREATE) registry.subscribe( self.update_security_group, resources.SECURITY_GROUP, events.AFTER_UPDATE) registry.subscribe( self.delete_security_group, resources.SECURITY_GROUP, events.AFTER_DELETE) registry.subscribe( self.create_security_group_rule, resources.SECURITY_GROUP_RULE, events.AFTER_CREATE) registry.subscribe( self.delete_security_group_rule, resources.SECURITY_GROUP_RULE, events.AFTER_DELETE)

subject: Add Service API
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/mistral refs/changes/35/193435/17 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from mistral.api.controllers.v2 import executor executors = executor.ExecutorsController()

subject: Add coordination feature to mistral service
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-19 06:59:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/mistral/commit/41dd67ec96966c60160c21788737505acf74ff83', 'message': 'Add coordination feature to executor service

As a user, I want to retrieve all the executors information in the system.
This patch adds coordination feature to executor service. The executor
will register itself as a coordinator. so, we can show all the executors
of the system through Mistral API(which will be covered in subsequent
patches).

Change-Id: Ibfcc17b35b9d2e408888b7d1cb64e63f2b32a90d
Partially-Implements: blueprint mistral-executor-membership
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-07-06 11:31:27.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/mistral/commit/8598b1da2254f14a5eb13f786b6aabc4b192dc42', 'message': 'Add coordination feature to mistral service

Add mistrai-api, mistral-engine, mistral-executor services to their
service group respectively when they start up, so that we can retrieve
their information through service api which will be implemented in
subsequent patch.

Partially-Implements: blueprint mistral-service-api

commit_message:
Add coordination feature to mistral service

Add mistrai-api, mistral-engine, mistral-executor services to their
service group respectively when they start up, so that we can retrieve
their information through service api which will be implemented in
subsequent patch.

Change-Id: Ibfcc17b35b9d2e408888b7d1cb64e63f2b32a90d
Partially-Implements: blueprint mistral-service-api
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/mistral refs/changes/34/193434/19 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from mistral.openstack.common import threadgroupcfg.CONF.import_opt('heartbeat', 'mistral.utils.coordination', group='coordination') EXECUTOR_GROUP_NAME = "executors_group" def register_service(service): service.service_coordinator.start() service.service_coordinator.join_group(EXECUTOR_GROUP_NAME) tg = threadgroup.ThreadGroup() if service.service_coordinator.is_active(): tg.add_timer( cfg.CONF.coordination.heartbeat, service.service_coordinator.heartbeat ) register_service(executor_v2)

commit_message:
Use correct library versions for py33

Some libraries are not directly compatible with py33
Thus, we need to install their py33 versions while
using py33

Change-Id: I404d09ae2e6252e120da3d09591562799013ff42
Closes-Bug: #1378537

commit_message:
Add Manila-GlusterFS experimental jobs

To test Manila with GlusterFS backend these jobs are needed. These
jobs are non-voting and experimental to Manila project. And
non-voting to devstack-plugin-glusterfs project.

Change-Id: I71526f43825cc4492059b9120ca2537d642c5524

Make ODL_NETVIRT_DEBUG_LOGS disabled by default, enabled in pre_test_hook.sh

Also tweak pre_test_hook.sh on how it appends to localrc

subject: devref: update quality_of_service
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/59/211259/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: One more thing to note is that though RPC interface relies on versioned objects, it does not yet rely on versioning features the oslo.versionedobjects library provides. This is because Liberty is the first release where we start using the RPC interface, so we have no way to get different versions in a cluster. That said, the versioning strategy for QoS is thought through and described in `the separate page <rpc_callbacks.html>`_. The flow of updates is as follows: * if a port that is bound to the agent is attached to a QoS policy, then ML2 plugin detects the change by relying on ML2 QoS extension driver, and notifies the agent about a port change. The agent proceeds with the notification by calling to get_device_details() and getting the new port dict that contains a new qos_policy_id. Each device details dict is passed into l2 agent extension manager that passes it down into every enabled extension, including QoS. QoS extension sees that there is a new unknown QoS policy for a port, so it uses ResourcesPullRpcApi to fetch the current state of the policy (with all the rules included) from the server. After that, the QoS extension applies the rules by calling into QoS driver that corresponds to the agent. * on existing QoS policy update (it includes any policy or its rules change), server pushes the new policy object state through ResourcesPushRpcApi interface. The interface fans out the serialized (dehydrated) object to any agent that is listening for QoS policy updates. If an agent have seen the policy before (it is attached to one of the ports it maintains), then it goes with applying the updates to the port. Otherwise, the agent silently ignores the update. defines QoS L2 agent extension. It receives handle_port and delete_port events and passes them down into QoS agent backend driver (see below). The file also defines the QosAgentDriver interface.At the moment, QoS is supported by Open vSwitch backend only. Every agent backend defines a QoS driver that reflects the QosAgentDriver interface. Open vSwitch ~~~~~~~~~~~~ TODO(QoS): describe low level interaction with ovs_lib and below.
deleted_lines: defines QoS L2 agent extension. It receives handle_port events and passes them into QoS agent backend driver (see below). The file also defines the QosAgentDriver interface for backend QoS drivers.At the moment, QoS is supported for the following agent backends: * Open vSwitch * SR-IOV All of them define QoS drivers that reflect the QosAgentDriver interface.

IntOpt should not provide min, as Opt doesn't recognize it.

commit_message:
Remove cell api overrides for force-delete

The force_delete method of nova/compute/cells_api module is actually
not needed, as this method handle objects and is triggered when
force-delete api is used for instance deletion in cells environment.

It actually causes a race condition with instance deletion as it
triggers 2 instance deletion from a compute cell for single
force-delete request.

Modified delete-api implementation so that force-delete request
triggers single instance deletion call in cells environment.

Change-Id: I812f27761fc4d4f64563d79f793c484d03aa641f
Closes-Bug: #1381425

commit_message:
Add an ability to manage use_stderr parameter

When logging is already set up, it can be useful to disable this option
to avoid logs duplication (collected by Upstart, for example)

Change-Id: I964b86798b4462e7f2ed8729d6938eff162f1694
Closes-bug: #1482564

commit_message:
Add related parameters to service::central section

This patch aims to add the following params to
service::central section.
  - managed_resource_email
  - managed_resource_tenant_id

Change-Id: I341d0d99fb843f2053b07ef189b93cbf75303649
closes-Bug: #1482204
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-designate refs/changes/07/209907/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Remove oslo_config from auth plugin loading

There is still the possibility of a dependency in session, however this
is the main usage. Defines a new option type schema.

Change-Id: Ie508dff449a92c9ea01c46285c10888135e93a97

commit_message:
Split plugin loading

One of the issues raised with keystoneclient plugins is the way that
loading of a plugin is mixed in with the definition of a plugin. Amongst
other things this really meant that there was only one way to utilize
each plugin class, to do another plugin that utilized an existing one
you would have to define a new class and proxy to it.

In this patch we split the concerns. There is a whole new section called
loading that is solely responsible for ways to load the auth plugin from
CLI or from argparse and other future methods.

This new section will likely be split into its own repository.

Change-Id: I8387b86fc0e3a8403f9806440196e8723eaf1ee4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystoneauth refs/changes/94/190594/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: from oslo_config import cfg @classmethod def get_options(cls): options = super(FederationBaseAuth, cls).get_options() options.extend([ cfg.StrOpt('identity-provider', help="Identity Provider's name"), cfg.StrOpt('protocol', help='Protocol for federated plugin'), ]) return options

commit_message:
Improve logging and prepare for gate

Switched all print statements to use logger

Added ability to halt operations via Ctrl-C, needs cleanup handler

Added realtime logging when using only one thread (matches bash building
scripts behavior)

main is now returning all the build image statuses, so a quick test
script would look like:

import build
res = build.main()
if len(res[0]):
    LOG.error('failure')

Change-Id: Ic8000a96573b011490dc330a4512c77c602ac3d2
Partially-Implements: blueprint build-script
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/16/202216/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # TODO(jpeeler): Add clean up handler for SIGINTimport loggingimport signallogging.basicConfig() LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) LOG.setLevel(logging.INFO) signal.signal(signal.SIGINT, signal.SIG_DFL) def __init__(self, queue, nocache, keep, threads): self.threads = threads LOG.info('Processing: {}'.format(image['name'])) if self.threads == 1: LOG.info('{}:{}'.format(image['name'], stream['stream'].rstrip())) if self.threads == 1: LOG.info('Processed: {}'.format(image['name'])) else: LOG.info('{}Processed: {}'.format(image['logs'], image['name'])) parser.add_argument('-d', '--debug', help='Turn on debugging log level', action='store_true') LOG.debug('Created working dir: {}'.format(self.working_dir)) LOG.debug('Found {}'.format(root.split(self.working_dir)[1])) LOG.debug('Found {} Dockerfiles'.format(len(self.docker_build_paths))) LOG.debug('Sorted parentless image: {}'.format( image['name'])) LOG.debug('Sorted image {} with parent {}'.format( image['name'], parent['fullname'])) LOG.debug('===') LOG.warning('Could not find parent image from some images.' ' Aborting') for image in images_to_process: LOG.warning('{} {}'.format(image['name'], image['parent'])) LOG.info("Successfully built images") LOG.info("=========================") LOG.info(image['name']) LOG.info("Images that failed to build") LOG.info("===========================") LOG.info('{}\r\t\t\t Failed with status: {}'.format( image['name'], image['status'])) def parseable_summary(self): """Temporary function to support expected output""" print('{', end="") for image in self.images: print("'{}':'{}',".format(image['fullname'].split(':')[0], image['status']), end="") print('}', end="") for count, tier in enumerate(self.tiers): LOG.debug('Tier {}: add image {}'.format(count, image['name'])) if args['debug']: LOG.setLevel(logging.DEBUG) WorkerThread(pool, args['no_cache'], args['keep'], args['threads']).start() # eventually this will be removed if args['debug']: kolla.parseable_summary()
deleted_lines: # TODO(SamYaple): Improve logging instead of printing to stdout def __init__(self, queue, nocache, keep): print('Processing:', image['name']) print(image['logs'], 'Processed:', image['name']) print('Could not find parent image from some images. Aborting', file=sys.stderr) for image in images_to_process: print(image['name'], image['parent'], file=sys.stderr) print("Successfully built images") print("=========================") print(image['name']) print("\nImages that failed to build") print("===========================") print(image['name'], "\r\t\t\t Failed with status:", image['status']) for tier in self.tiers: WorkerThread(pool, args['no_cache'], args['keep']).start()

commit_message:
SR-IOV: Convert max rate from kbps to Mbps

ip link tool configures max rate in Mbps and
it the QoS model max rate is defined in kbps. This
patch convert the max rate from kbps to Mbps. Also
because zero disables the rate limit the min value
is 1Mbps and not 1kbps.

DocImpact
Partially-Implements: blueprint ml2-sriov-qos-with-bwlimiting
Change-Id: I91b08c5d8ccaa2867b6eafd0c86872f401dd04c8

commit_message:
drop neutron_plugin_ovs type/provider

In Kilo, we removed Neutron OVS plugin because it was dropped in Juno in
favor of using ML2 plugin.

We missed to drop the neutron_plugin_ovs type/provider in the patch and
this is what this patch aims about.

Change-Id: Ic9addc51de43ec67db4835072be61e1306281611

commit_message:
midonet: define reference to midonet mech driver

Introduces a reference to the midonet ml2 mechanism driver,
and a corresponding directory.

Partially-Implements:

https://blueprints.launchpad.net/networking-midonet/+spec/midonet-ml2

Change-Id: I37bc6e591d9c046602f32bbf3973e831242f75ec
Closes-bug: #1474651
Signed-off-by: Joe Mills <joe@midokura.com>

commit_message:
Disable optional authentication for plugin

Rework the tests to extract a mock fixture that is capable of mocking
server authenticated requests. Set the plugin to mutual authentication
by default.

Closes-Bug: #1482468
Change-Id: I06daea59d25cd63c552f2db9f663bbc33e659ed5

commit_message:
Add periodic/experimental tempest job for using test accounts

This commit adds 2 new jobs for using tempest's test accounts
mechanism. This is an alternate tempest configuration which enables
using a static set of multiple credentials which provide isolation
between tests instead of dynamically creating them. This configuration
is eventually going to replace the traditional config options for
credentials but before we can deprecate the old options we need to
have bit rot jobs setup to make sure we don't break this feature.

Change-Id: I58b68d422ee4aeee8e4e143a9e257bb6e6b9214f
Depends-On: I8682f72ffe26fd133874f5c575df6389f787ffcc

commit_message:
Tests: Fix os.path.exists mock (emc_vnxdirect)

Use mock rather than assigning to os.path.exists,
since this may cause later tests to break.

commit_message:
Stop doing any magic cloning of neutron during CI

Hopefully this will allow the Zuul "Depends-On" thing to work better.

Adopting the solution developed by Doug Wiegley for LBaaS:
c61f920f2a54fd829ee37484b3743ab77b909847

Change-Id: Id3f716b9f151dbb99cc02ddec00a841bea7ad463

commit_message:
Import oslo_messaging instead of oslo.messaging

This fixes the unit tests.

To get jenkins to pass we also need to comment out the migration
check for pep8 temporarily. This check will be re-enabled with
https://review.openstack.org/205866

Change-Id: If8484812e7cd026727b920fa70182db23154df58

commit_message:
Support host type specific block volume attachment

----
NOTE(markus_z): This is a "backport" of commit
b1a8c2e1f18d424adfdfa29bae47cafa4700dcee which is merged in os-brick.
That patch is marked as implementing a blueprint, but should have
been a bug in the first place. The blueprint support-hosttype-on-attach
shouldn't have been necessary.
----

Add the platform and operating system type to the connector to allow a
Cinder driver to set host type specific configuration attributes when
attaching a Fibre-Channel volume.

Closes-Bug: #1471810

Change-Id: I2eef20b46808a49a330c64d517ad6430392674fd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/92/209192/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Allow searching a catalog on service or endpoint id

endpoint_id and service_id are parts of both the v2 and v3 tokens. We
should allow finding urls for them in the same way as other attributes.

Change-Id: I22b5f4bd44e9a493017de89e14a705699df24280
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystoneauth refs/changes/67/210267/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_service_catalog_endpoint_id(self): token = fixture.V2Token() token.set_scope() endpoint_id = uuid.uuid4().hex public_url = uuid.uuid4().hex s = token.add_service('compute') s.add_endpoint(public=public_url, id=endpoint_id) s.add_endpoint(public=uuid.uuid4().hex) auth_ref = access.create(body=token) # initially assert that we get back all our urls for a simple filter urls = auth_ref.service_catalog.get_urls(service_type='compute', endpoint_type='public') self.assertEqual(2, len(urls)) urls = auth_ref.service_catalog.get_urls(service_type='compute', endpoint_id=endpoint_id, endpoint_type='public') self.assertEqual((public_url, ), urls) # with bad endpoint_id nothing should be found urls = auth_ref.service_catalog.get_urls(service_type='compute', endpoint_id=uuid.uuid4().hex, endpoint_type='public') self.assertEqual(0, len(urls)) # we ignore a service_id because v2 doesn't know what it is urls = auth_ref.service_catalog.get_urls(service_type='compute', endpoint_id=endpoint_id, service_id=uuid.uuid4().hex, endpoint_type='public') self.assertEqual((public_url, ), urls)

commit_message:
Add ability to specify number of workers for glance-registry service

Currently we haven't ability to specify number of workers for glance-registry.
So this patch implements this feature.

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/kilo/config-reference/content/section_glance-registry.conf.html

Change-Id: I71eb22d2ad15cd9c9d50e3370a3867f7298b47ca

DB purge cron job

"cinder-manage db purge".

See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. # # == Class: nova::cron::archive_deleted_rows # # Move deleted instances to another table that you don't have to backup # unless you have data retention policies. # # === Parameters # # [*minute*] # (optional) Defaults to '1'. # # [*hour*] # (optional) Defaults to '0'. # # [*monthday*] # (optional) Defaults to '*'. # # [*month*] # (optional) Defaults to '*'. # # [*weekday*] # (optional) Defaults to '*'. # # [*user*] # (optional) User with access to nova files. # Defaults to 'nova'. # # [*age*] # (optional) Number of days prior to today for deletion, # e.g. value 60 means to purge deleted rows that have the "deleted_at" # column greater than 60 days ago. # Defaults to 30 # # [*destination*] # (optional) Path to file to which rows should be archived # Defaults to '/var/log/nova/nova-rowsflush.log'. # class cinder::cron::db_purge ( $minute = 1, $hour = 0, $monthday = '*', $month = '*', $weekday = '*', $user = 'cinder', $age = 30, $destination = '/var/log/cinder/cinder-rowsflush.log' ) { cron { 'nova-manage db archive_deleted_rows': command => "cinder-manage db purge ${age} >>${destination} 2>&1", environment => 'PATH=/bin:/usr/bin:/usr/sbin SHELL=/bin/sh', user => $user, minute => $minute, hour => $hour, monthday => $monthday, month => $month, weekday => $weekday, require => Package['cinder'], } }

Use automaton 0.5.0

Ironic is using a converter functionality that requires
this newer version being listed, so we should properly
list it so they can use it without issue.

commit_message:
MariaDB datastore support

Specification for the support addition for MariaDB in Trove

Change-Id: I93e19e7567d7e9376dd45d69c79cff0e053d0ed4
Related: blueprint mariadb-datastore-support
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/trove-specs refs/changes/30/211330/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ========================= MariaDB Datastore Support ========================= MariaDB [1]_ is a community-developed fork of MySQL licensed under GNU GPL. It aims to maintain high compatibility with MySQL, ensuring a "drop-in" replacement capability with library binary equivalency and exact matching with MySQL APIs and commands. https://blueprints.launchpad.net/trove/+spec/mariadb-datastore-support Problem Description =================== MariaDB versioning follow the MySQL's versioning scheme up to version 5.5. Thus, MariaDB 5.5 offers all of the MySQL 5.5 features. After the 5.5 version, MariaDB developers decided to start a branch numbered 10, as an attempt to make it clear that specific new features have been developed in MariaDB 10 that are not included in MySQL 5.6. Currently, Trove has support for MySQL but not for MariaDB in particular. This could be easily fixed for MariaDB 5.5 by just adapting the main configuration file (my.cnf). But in the case of MariaDB 10, this will be not longer so straightforward. With this in mind, and the fact that several GNU/Linux distributions are adopting MariaDB as the default MySQL implementation, it seems a important to start working on adding support for this datastore. Proposed Change =============== To add support for this datastore, we will need the following: - Implement instance management for the datastore: - Launch new instance - Terminate instance - Reboot instance - Resize instance - Implement user and database management for the datastore: - CRUD users - CRUD databases - Add new elements in trove-integration projects to enable the creation of Ubuntu/Fedora images with MariaDB In this first approach, it makes sense to take profit of the MySQL Refactor spec [2]_ and inherit as much as possible from the MySQL implementation, providing a cleaner way to launch MariaDB 5.5 instances. In a follow up spec, differences in implementation will be tackled (e.g. a GTID based replication strategy [3]_ for MariaDB 10 will be proposed) and we would be able to provide support for MariaDB newer versions. Configuration ------------- A new configuration group for MariaDB and the different configuration options specific to MariaDB have to be added to trove/common/cfg.py Some of the examples for the configuration options are: - tcp_ports - udp_ports - backup_strategy - backup_incremental_strategy - replication_strategy - mount_point - volume_support - device_path - backup_namespace - restore_namespace Database -------- None Public API ---------- None Public API Security ------------------- None Python API ---------- None CLI (python-troveclient) ------------------------ None Internal API ------------ None Guest Agent ----------- - This requires implementing the various datastore features for MariaDB like Launch, Reboot, Terminate and Resize. - This requires implementing the various CRUD features for users and databases for MariaDB. - This will include adding the following files specific to MariaDB under the guestagent/datastore module: - manager.py - service.py These changes will not affect the behavior of the guestagent or its interaction with other components. Alternatives ------------ Do not support MariaDB. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: - vkmc Milestones ---------- Liberty-3 Work Items ---------- - Update trove-integration to support MariaDB image creation - Create MariaDB elements for Ubuntu/Fedora - Update trove/common/cnf.py with the configuration options for MariaDB - Add MariaDB configuration templates under templates/mariadb - Add support for instance management features in guestagent/experimental/mariadb/service.py [*] - Add support for user and databases management features in guestagent/experimental/mariadb/service.py [*] - Add unit and integration tests specific to MariaDB [*] This items rely on the MySQL Manager Refactor spec [2]_ and in the first iteration it will only require inheriting from the MySQL existing implementation. Upgrade Implications ==================== None Dependencies ============ MySQL Manager Refactor [2]_ Testing ======= - Unit tests will be added for MariaDB guestagent - Integration tests will be added for end-to-end feature testing - Create/Delete MariaDB instances - Resize MariaDB instances Documentation Impact ==================== - Docs will be updated to indicate that: - Which MariaDB version is supported - Trove capabilities for MariaDB datastore - Instructions to build guest MariaDB images using trove-integration elements References ========== .. [1] https://mariadb.org/ .. [2] http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/trove-specs/specs/liberty/mysql-manager-refactor.html .. [3] https://mariadb.com/kb/en/mariadb/global-transaction-id/

commit_message:
Add show_resource function to Mistral resources (4)

AWS resources will not be changed due to they do not support additional
attributes. So 'show' attribute will be presented in their schemas, but
will return always None.

This patch adds show_resource method for heat (mistral) resources:
 - workflow
 - cron trigger

Change-Id: I10599a0eb45c99acb44414147d04734e740afcf0

commit_message:
Create auxiliary repo with fuel version

Fuel 7.0 auxiliary repo should be created
as /etc/yum.repos.d/7.0_auxiliary

This helps with upgrade/rollback process for
Fuel Master.

The configuration for auxiliary repository on
deployed Fuel nodes is unchanged.

Change-Id: Iec2645ddbee6b1b6b9e5c2816707b275542ef51b
Partial-Bug: #1480282

subject: Accept blocking argument in lock's context manager
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-17 14:39:16.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tooz/commit/2b36d990a2ed5a5efb0a9c4a08dd653a07396bed', 'message': 'Add default blocking value for lock acquire

This patch adds a default blocking value, on lock creation and get_lock,
to be used in any acquire method call by default. It also adds the
possibility to pass a locking value to the context manager to override
this default value.

The idea is that you can now do things like:

1) Create a lock with a default blocking value that will be used by this
object in all acquire operations (if there is no override)
    lock = FileLock(path, 10.0)

2) Pass a default blocking value to the get_lock method that will be
used by returned lock in all acquire operations (if there is no
override)
    coord.get_lock(name, False)
    coord.get_lock(name, 10.0)

2) Create a context manager with a specific blocking value that
overrides default blocking value and will not be used in any other
acquire operation after exiting the context
    lock = coord.get_lock(name)
    with lock(10.0):
        ...

Change-Id: I6d2f486ac45078ec4ce77de52b7997f2122d4dc8
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-07-30 11:20:13.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tooz/commit/915d8a3153a77a2079539d6deba1587376b91b40', 'message': "Accept blocking argument in lock's context manager

context manager in any of the following ways:

    with lock(False):
    with lock():
    with lock:

The last 2 are equivalent.

commit_message:
Accept blocking argument in lock's context manager

This patch adds the posibility of passing the blocking argument to the
context manager to be used when acquiring the lock.

Previous behavior will be preserved, so now we will be able to use the
context manager in any of the following ways:

    with lock(10.0):
    with lock(False):
    with lock():
    with lock:

The last 2 are equivalent.

Change-Id: I6d2f486ac45078ec4ce77de52b7997f2122d4dc8

added_lines: def __init__(self, coord, client, name, timeout, blocking=True): super(RedisLock, self).__init__(name, blocking) def acquire(self, blocking=None): blocking = blocking if blocking is not None else self.default_blocking def get_lock(self, name, blocking): return RedisLock(self, self._client, name, self.lock_timeout, blocking)
deleted_lines: def __init__(self, coord, client, name, timeout): super(RedisLock, self).__init__(name) def acquire(self, blocking=True): def get_lock(self, name): return RedisLock(self, self._client, name, self.lock_timeout)

revisions:

which has inaccurate check for dead agents: in a case where
there is only one network scheduled to a subset of dhcp agents,
number of all dhcp agents will be not equal to the number of

commit_message:
Fix: Skip rescheduling networks if no DHCP agents available

This fixes commit 1318437a0caf38e695a819848832a955fef7d909
which has inaccurate check for dead agents: in a case where
there is only one network scheduled to a subset of dhcp agents,
number of all dhcp agents will be not equal to the number of
dead binded agents

The unit test is updated to cover the described case.

Closes-Bug: #1461714
Change-Id: I1c9501316c931293aa8ba755a98779a7da27578d

commit_message:
Use openstack/ namespace for fixtures modules

When running the tests, rspec will download the modules speficied in
.fixtures.yml and put them in spec/fixtures/modules.

Some of those modules still point to stackforge/ namespace when they
should be pointing to openstack/ namespace.

Change-Id: I82c77e95a18e3f4545dcb344d4eb6ab344b21790

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary trailing backslash in Installation Guide

This patch removes unnecessary trailing backslash from the command
line in Installation Guide so that user can copy and paste the command
line.

     ironic node-update $NODE_UUID add \
     driver_info/deploy_kernel=$DEPLOY_VMLINUZ_UUID \
-    driver_info/deploy_ramdisk=$DEPLOY_INITRD_UUID \
+    driver_info/deploy_ramdisk=$DEPLOY_INITRD_UUID

Change-Id: I96dfb580250e1bf3bb2a6b6b7470d87f56ee2553
